title.narrative: Réhabilitation des Ecoles Fondamentales et Aménagement des Latrines dans la Province de MURAMVYA

description.narrative: In the National Development Plan 2018-2027 (NDP Burundi 2018-2027), strengthening the education system is one of the national priorities. Its strategic objective is to develop an efficient education system that meets national needs and international standards. Since 2005, a major reform involving the abolition of school fees in primary education and the introduction of the basic cycle from 2013-14 has made it possible to achieve a high gross enrolment rate for the first six years of basic education. However, the number and quality of infrastructures have not kept pace with this, resulting in a critical shortage of classrooms and latrines that meet standards. Indeed, in 2019, the 4091 basic schools had 35 212 classrooms and 25 123 pupils, i.e. 72 pupils per class. In addition, the statistical yearbook for the 2019-2020 school year reports that out of 1697 schools, schools have an average of only 0.7 toilets for girls and 1.4 toilets for boys in good condition per school. In addition, a significant number of schools are regularly hit by bad weather, for example during the 2019-2020 school year, out of 4,359 schools, 361 (or 8%) including 781 classrooms were hit by bad weather.

The aim objective is: The quality of education is improved and the contribution to the reduction of the dropout rate is ensured in the basic schools concerned by the project. The specific objectives are: 1.Pupils in the Basic Schools concerned by the project have access to infrastructure (classrooms and latrines) that meets the quality standards of education. 2.In the rehabilitated schools, pupils with disabilities will have accessible latrines adapted to their situation 3.Pupils and service providers in the basic schools concerned change their attitudes and practices with regard to the use and maintenance of the infrastructure received.

The direct beneficiaries are the 1941 pupils including disabled pupils and 52 staff of the two schools concerned The indirect beneficiaries are the parents of the pupils and providers of the rehabilitated ECOFO and the population of the communes of Rutegama and Muramvya
